snippet: Much as they did four years ago when they upset the Patriots, the Giants have overcome adversity, and they have won when they needed it most.
abstract: Harvey Araton Sports of The Times column contends that the New York Giants are a compelling team because of their propensity for overcoming adversity and winning key games when they need it most.
lead_paragraph: Much as they did four years ago when they upset the Patriots, the Giants have overcome adversity, and they have won when they needed it most.

headline.seo: Giants Are Endearing Because They Suffer to Succeed
headline.main: Giants Are Inspiring Because They Suffer, Then Succeed
headline.print_headline: Giants Are Inspiring Because They Suffer, Then Succeed
